definition: a device incised to make an impression, destroy or extinguish as if by stamping with the foot
details:
noun
- a device incised to make an impression
= synonyms: seal
- a block or die used to imprint a mark or design
- machine consisting of a heavy bar that moves vertically for pounding or crushing ores
= synonyms: pestle
- a small adhesive token stuck on a letter or package to indicate that that postal fees have been paid
= synonyms: postage, postage stamp
- a symbol that is the result of printing or engraving
= example: a symbol that is the result of printing or engraving
= synonyms: impression
- a small piece of adhesive paper that is put on an object to show that a government tax has been paid
= synonyms: revenue stamp
- a type or class
= example: a type or class
- something that can be used as an official medium of payment
= synonyms: tender
- the distinctive form in which a thing is made
= synonyms: cast
verb
- destroy or extinguish as if by stamping with the foot
- treat or classify according to a mental stereotype
= synonyms: pigeonhole
- to mark, or produce an imprint in or on something
= example: to mark, or produce an imprint in or on something
- affix a stamp to
= example: affix a stamp to
- raise in a relief
= synonyms: emboss
- crush or grind with a heavy instrument
= example: crush or grind with a heavy instrument
- form or cut out with a mold, form, or die
= example: form or cut out with a mold, form, or die
- walk heavily
= synonyms: stomp
- reveal clearly as having a certain character
= example: reveal clearly as having a certain character
